More than one billion Indians: Is this a problem or a sea of opportunities? Please take a stand and discuss

More than one billion Indians:- I am in favour that , this is a problem and not a sea of opportunities. Since India is a developing country, and also facing many serious problems like poverty, unemployement, population growth day by day,very low national income as compared to other countries..

These problems itself are very seroius and are not getting solved, than how can we say more than one billion people(high population) are  a sea of opportunites instead of being a problem....

large number of people demand large number of services and if these services are not being fulfilled due to its excess demand, we can say that these large number of  people are creating a problem of  high demand and low supply.

We can take Another Example from our daily life:-

A family having 4-5 children is not able to give good education and facilities to thier children instead a family having one child or even two, easily gives good education and anyother facility which is demanded...In short we can say, basic needs are also not fulfilled easily if family members get increased. than how can we say that one billion people are not a problem even when they are effecting nations growth and development..

This growing population is directly effecting our nation's growth and development. Excess of any thing is always harmfull and dangerous. we are to deal with the problem of illiteracy, unemployment, poverty, and this is not possible or its difficult to deal due to this high population. laarge population require large source of education, than employment opportunites for job, and many other things failing which causes poverty, unemployment,illiteracy, corruption, and many other serious problems which are even out of our reach.

so, to overcome these problems govt. should take some strict actions.  Alone govt. can't do anythting, so general people also need to help and support govt at their best. This increasing population can not be stoped but can be reduced, for our own sake and for our country's sake.

At the end i would only like to say that more than one billion Indains  are really a problem for India..., developing India... it might not be if india is..... developed india..
